values.description: Now that we have components in ign-cmake, try adding one for eigen that allows conversion between ignition and eigen types. I marked this WIP, because it needs a unit test and I don't know what to add to `eigen3/src/CMakeLists.txt`.
values.title: Component for converting between eigen3 and ignition-math (part of #19)

summary.raw: Now that we have components in ign-cmake, try adding one for eigen that allows conversion between ignition and eigen types. I marked this WIP, because it needs a unit test and I don't know what to add to `eigen3/src/CMakeLists.txt`.
summary.html: Now that we have components in ign-cmake, try adding one for eigen that allows conversion between ignition and eigen types. I marked this WIP, because it needs a unit test and I don't know what to add to eigen3/src/CMakeLists.txt.

values.description:
Moved `Box` to AxisAlignedBox, and implemented a new templatized Box class that is not axis-aligned and contains material properties.

I did not make changes, other than naming, to `AxisAlignedBox`. We can look into inheritance or composition with `Box` in a different PR.

I did not deprecate the existing `Box` class on purpose. There is a note in the migration guide.
values.title: Mat set from box boxclass

summary.raw:
Moved `Box` to AxisAlignedBox, and implemented a new templatized Box class that is not axis-aligned and contains material properties.

I did not make changes, other than naming, to `AxisAlignedBox`. We can look into inheritance or composition with `Box` in a different PR.

I did not deprecate the existing `Box` class on purpose. There is a note in the migration guide.
summary.html:
Moved Box to AxisAlignedBox, and implemented a new templatized Box class that is not axis-aligned and contains material properties.

I did not make changes, other than naming, to AxisAlignedBox. We can look into inheritance or composition with Box in a different PR.

I did not deprecate the existing Box class on purpose. There is a note in the migration guide.

values.description:
This PR updates a few validity checks in MassMatrix and Inertial to accept a tolerance value.

The use case is in [sdformat pr #429](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/429/expand-acceptable-massmatrix-moments-and/diff).
values.title: Update validity checks in MassMatrix to accept a tolerance

summary.raw:
This PR updates a few validity checks in MassMatrix and Inertial to accept a tolerance value.

The use case is in [sdformat pr #429](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/429/expand-acceptable-massmatrix-moments-and/diff).
summary.html:
This PR updates a few validity checks in MassMatrix and Inertial to accept a tolerance value.

The use case is in sdformat pr #429.

* pass Vector3 as const reference instead of copy in `Vector3::RotateVectorReverse`. this shows up in cppcheck on homebrew

values.description:

Fixes #93

Fixes #93

values.description:
The [latest googletest release](https://github.com/google/googletest/releases) is 1.8.0 from August 2016. The windows build needs the following commit from Dev 2017:

* https://github.com/google/googletest/commit/57bb0bbbf80b006f35a249951fe2e051221173ae

I've taken the current head of the master branch.

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64&build=442)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/442/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/442/

values.description:
There were some breaking changes to the `Box` class in pull request #257, so ign-rendering doesn't compile against the default branch of ign-math:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/67

So let's make another prerelease. Here's the changes since the last one:

#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/branches/compare/bump5pre3%0Dignition-math5_5.0.0~pre2#pull-requests
values.title: Bump to 5.0.0~pre3 in preparation of new prerelease

values.description:
* revert IsPositive function to previous behavior

* use DiagonalMoments instead of PrincipalMoments in Epsilon function since it is computationally cheaper and has a valid trace

* EquivalentBox: call IsPositive with an explicit tolerance of 0, since inertia must be positive

* Add IsNearPositive and use in IsValid, update tests and migration guide
values.title: Updates to pull request #264

summary.raw:
* revert IsPositive function to previous behavior

* use DiagonalMoments instead of PrincipalMoments in Epsilon function since it is computationally cheaper and has a valid trace

* EquivalentBox: call IsPositive with an explicit tolerance of 0, since inertia must be positive

* Add IsNearPositive and use in IsValid, update tests and migration guide
summary.html:
• revert IsPositive function to previous behavior

  • use DiagonalMoments instead of PrincipalMoments in Epsilon function since it is computationally cheaper and has a valid trace

  • EquivalentBox: call IsPositive with an explicit tolerance of 0, since inertia must be positive

  • Add IsNearPositive and use in IsValid, update tests and migration guide

values.description:
This merges some windows warning fixes forward, but it seems to cause a new warning on gcc, related to the fact that we aren't passing `-std=c++11` when building the gtest code.

* new gtest on ign-math2 to fix windows compiler warnings

* try to fix some signed-unsigned mismatch windows warnings (C4389)

* one more unsigned fix

* Close branch new_gtest_2

* Close branch new_gtest_2_unsigned

* remove old gtest diff

values.description:
This makes a small change to the pipeline script and also tries using the latest `ign-cmake` from the `gz11` branch. The test coverage is back up over 90% with this. See the following issue for more details:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/issues/46/coverage-testing-on-gz11-fails-to-exclude

As an alternative to building `ign-cmake` from source, we could make another prerelease.
values.title: Use latest ign-cmake for improved test coverage

summary.raw:

As an alternative to building `ign-cmake` from source, we could make another prerelease.
summary.html:
This makes a small change to the pipeline script and also tries using the latest ign-cmake from the gz11 branch. The test coverage is back up over 90% with this. See the following issue for more details:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/issues/46/coverage-testing-on-gz11-fails-to-exclude

As an alternative to building ign-cmake from source, we could make another prerelease.

values.description:
I'm working on some new tutorials for sdformat, and I thought it would be helpful to create an example command-line utility for converting between the Euler angles used in the latter half of the `<pose>` tag and a Quaternion or Rotation matrix. This adds the following two standalone example programs:

* `quaternion_from_euler`: takes 3 floating point arguments (`roll`, `pitch`, `yaw` angles in radians) from the command line and prints out the equivalent angles in degrees and the equivalent quaternion and rotation matrix.
* `quaternion_to_euler`: takes 4 floating point arguments (`w`, `x`, `y`, `z`) from the command line and prints out the normalized quaternion components, the equivalent roll/pitch/yaw in radians and degrees, and the equivalent rotation matrix.

~~~
$ ./quaternion_from_euler -2.36 0 0
Converting Euler angles:
 roll  -2.360000 radians
 pitch  0.000000 radians
 yaw    0.000000 radians

 roll   -135.218040 degrees
 pitch     0.000000 degrees
 yaw       0.000000 degrees

to Quaternion
 W  0.380925
 X -0.924606
 Y  0.000000
 Z  0.000000

to Rotation matrix
    1.000000  -0.000000   0.000000
    0.000000  -0.709793   0.704411
   -0.000000  -0.704411  -0.709793
~~~

~~~
$ ./quaternion_to_euler 0 0 3 4
Normalizing Quaternion components:
  W 0
  X 0
  Y 3
  Z 4
to
  W 0
  X 0
  Y 0.6
  Z 0.8

Converting to Euler angles
 roll   1.287002 radians
 pitch -0.000000 radians
 yaw    3.141593 radians

 roll   73.739795 degrees
 pitch -0.000000 degrees
 yaw    180.000000 degrees

to Rotation matrix
   -1.000000   0.000000   0.000000
    0.000000  -0.280000   0.960000
    0.000000   0.960000   0.280000
~~~
values.title: Examples: converting between Euler angles, quaternions, and rotation matrices

summary.html:
I'm working on some new tutorials for sdformat, and I thought it would be helpful to create an example command-line utility for converting between the Euler angles used in the latter half of the <pose> tag and a Quaternion or Rotation matrix. This adds the following two standalone example programs:

  • quaternion_from_euler: takes 3 floating point arguments (roll, pitch, yaw angles in radians) from the command line and prints out the equivalent angles in degrees and the equivalent quaternion and rotation matrix.
  • quaternion_to_euler: takes 4 floating point arguments (w, x, y, z) from the command line and prints out the normalized quaternion components, the equivalent roll/pitch/yaw in radians and degrees, and the equivalent rotation matrix.
$ ./quaternion_from_euler -2.36 0 0
Converting Euler angles:
 roll  -2.360000 radians
 pitch  0.000000 radians
 yaw    0.000000 radians

 roll   -135.218040 degrees
 pitch     0.000000 degrees
 yaw       0.000000 degrees

to Quaternion
 W  0.380925
 X -0.924606
 Y  0.000000
 Z  0.000000

to Rotation matrix
    1.000000  -0.000000   0.000000
    0.000000  -0.709793   0.704411
   -0.000000  -0.704411  -0.709793

$ ./quaternion_to_euler 0 0 3 4
Normalizing Quaternion components:
  W 0
  X 0
  Y 3
  Z 4
to
  W 0
  X 0
  Y 0.6
  Z 0.8

Converting to Euler angles
 roll   1.287002 radians
 pitch -0.000000 radians
 yaw    3.141593 radians

 roll   73.739795 degrees
 pitch -0.000000 degrees
 yaw    180.000000 degrees

to Rotation matrix
   -1.000000   0.000000   0.000000
    0.000000  -0.280000   0.960000
    0.000000   0.960000   0.280000

values.description:
This merges gz11 back to default. This will become ign-math6. There has already been a release of ign-math5. Support for xenial will stop here.

Alternatively, we could make a ign-math6 release of what is currently on default, and then merge gz11 to ign-math7.
values.title: Gz11 to default

summary.raw:
This merges gz11 back to default. This will become ign-math6. There has already been a release of ign-math5. Support for xenial will stop here.

Alternatively, we could make a ign-math6 release of what is currently on default, and then merge gz11 to ign-math7.
summary.html:
This merges gz11 back to default. This will become ign-math6. There has already been a release of ign-math5. Support for xenial will stop here.

Alternatively, we could make a ign-math6 release of what is currently on default, and then merge gz11 to ign-math7.

values.description: The readme was updated in pull request #293 to default, but that hadn't been merged to the ign-math5 branch. Also, the default branch of ign-cmake is now ign-cmake2, so change the appveyor.yml and configure.bat script to use the ign-cmake1 branch instead of default.
values.title: math5: merge readme from old default, fix windows builds
